intro: Solanum rizzinianum, commonly known as the Rizzini's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and卵形 (ovate) leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into berries, which are typically yellow or orange when mature. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
